PI_SCREEN_SETUP.PLUGIN_DESC: Configure display outputs for Raspberry Pi
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.STEP0_DESC: How would you like to configure your display?
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.DETECT_MODE_DOC: Auto-detect scans current display state and pre-populates settings
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.STEP1_DESC: Choose your primary display connection. The UI will reload after selection.
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.PRIMARY_OUTPUT_DOC: Select the physical connector your display is connected to
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.STEP2_HDMI_DESC: Configure HDMI output settings. The UI will reload after saving.
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.HDMI_MODE_DOC: Select video and audio output mode
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.HDMI_SECONDARY_MODE_DOC: Configure secondary HDMI port for additional output or audio
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.HDMI_AUDIO_MODE_DOC: Configure HDMI port for audio output
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.DISPLAY_PRESET_DOC: Select your display model for optimal settings, or use Auto Detect
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.HDMI_CUSTOM_TIMINGS_DOC: Enter hdmi_timings (17 values) or hdmi_cvt (3-7 values) format
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.HDMI_CUSTOM_PARAMS_DOC: Additional config.txt lines (one per line). Example: max_framebuffer_height=1480
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.HDMI_FORCE_HOTPLUG_DOC: Force HDMI output even if no display detected. Enable if display is not detected at boot.
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.HDMI_IGNORE_EDID_DOC: Ignore display EDID data. Use with problematic displays.
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.HDMI_BOOST_DOC: Increase HDMI signal strength for long cables. Higher values may cause interference.
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.STEP2_AUDIO_DESC: Configure HDMI audio output (optional). The UI will reload after saving.
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.STEP2_DSI_DESC: Configure DSI ribbon display. The UI will reload after saving.
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.STEP2_DPI_DESC: Configure DPI display connected via GPIO. The UI will reload after saving.
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.DPI_CUSTOM_TIMING_DOC: Custom DPI timing parameters if needed
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.STEP2_COMPOSITE_DESC: Configure composite (RCA) video output. The UI will reload after saving.
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.COMPOSITE_MODE_DOC: Select the TV standard for your region
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.STEP2_CUSTOM_DESC: Enter custom overlay configuration. The UI will reload after saving.
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.CUSTOM_OVERLAY_LINE_DOC: Enter the complete dtoverlay line (e.g., dtoverlay=my-display,rotate=90)
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.STEP3_DESC: Configure screen rotation. The UI will reload after saving.
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.CMDLINE_VIDEO_DOC: Add rotation to video= parameter in cmdline.txt (DRM/KMS rotation)
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.CMDLINE_FBCON_DOC: Add fbcon=rotate: parameter in cmdline.txt (console text rotation)
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.CMDLINE_PLYMOUTH_DOC: Add plymouth= parameter in cmdline.txt (boot splash rotation)
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.STEP4_DESC: Configure KMS/CMA memory allocation. The UI will reload after saving.
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.CMA_OPTION_DOC: Contiguous Memory Allocator size for graphics. Larger values improve graphics performance but reduce available RAM.
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.CMA_CUSTOM_MB_DOC: Enter custom CMA size in megabytes (16-512)
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.STEP5_DESC: Configure how the plugin handles system updates. The UI will reload after saving.
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.OTA_BEHAVIOR_DOC: How to handle display configuration after Volumio updates
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.STEP6_DESC: Review the configuration before applying. A reboot will be required.
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.MIGRATION_DETECTED_DESC: Display settings found in other configuration files. Choose how to proceed.
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.VALIDATE_IMPORT_DOC: Parse settings, validate values, and import to Pi Screen Setup
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.IMPORT_ASIS_DOC: Import settings without validation - for advanced users
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.SKIP_FRESH_DOC: Ignore existing settings and configure from scratch
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.MIGRATION_REVIEW_DESC: Review the imported configuration before applying
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.ACCEPT_APPLY_DOC: Apply these settings and complete setup
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.RECONFIGURE_FULL_DOC: Discard imported settings and use the step-by-step wizard
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.VALIDATION_WARNINGS: Some settings not recognized (will be preserved as-is)
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.SECTION_MIGRATION_DESC: Existing display settings detected in other configuration files
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.MIGRATE_NOW_DOC: Move detected settings to Pi Screen Setup management
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.RESTORE_BACKUP_DOC: Restore the previous videoconfig.txt from backup
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.COMPOSITE_DISABLES_HDMI: Note: Composite output disables HDMI on Pi 4/5
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.LOW_RAM_WARNING: Low RAM detected - large CMA sizes not recommended
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.CONFIG_DRIFT_DETECTED: Display configuration was modified. Restoring settings.
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.CONFIG_DRIFT_MESSAGE: Your display configuration was modified (possibly by a system update). Would you like to restore your Pi Screen Setup configuration?
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.CONFIG_APPLIED: Configuration applied. Please reboot for changes to take effect.
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.REBOOT_MESSAGE: Display configuration has been saved. A reboot is required for changes to take effect.
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.WIZARD_RESET: Configuration wizard reset. Starting from step 1.
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.OVERLAY_NOT_FOUND: Warning: Overlay file {name}.dtbo not found in /boot/overlays
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.RESTORE_POINT_DOC: Select a previous configuration to restore
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.RESTORE_SELECTED_DOC: Restore boot configuration from the selected restore point
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.RESTORE_SUCCESS: Configuration restored successfully. Reboot to apply changes.
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.RESTORE_FACTORY_DOC: Reset to original boot configuration from before plugin installation
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.FACTORY_RESTORE_CONFIRM: This will restore the original boot configuration from when the plugin was first installed. All display settings will be removed. Are you sure?
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.FACTORY_RESTORE_SUCCESS: Factory defaults restored. Reboot to apply changes.
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.FACTORY_REBOOT_MESSAGE: Factory defaults have been restored. A reboot is required to apply the original configuration.
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.PM_SHOW_ADVANCED_DOC: Show hostname override option for systems where mDNS is not working
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.DB_OPEN_SETTINGS_DOC: Open database update and maintenance settings
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.DB_CHECK_UPDATE_DOC: Check if a newer database version is available
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.DB_OPEN_MANAGER_DOC: Open the web-based preset management interface in a new tab
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.DB_HOSTNAME_OVERRIDE_DOC: If mDNS is not working, enter the device IP address (e.g. 192.168.1.100) to use for the Preset Manager link
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.DB_REVERT_DOC: Discard cached updates and use the database bundled with the plugin
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.DB_REMOTE_URL_DOC: URL to check for database updates
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.DB_AUTO_CHECK_DOC: Automatically check for updates on plugin start
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.DB_TOGGLE_ADMIN_DOC: Enable or disable the preset entries manager
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.SECTION_ADMIN_DESC: Add, modify, or remove display presets (working copy)
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.ADMIN_DRAFT_VERSION_DOC: Version string for the draft database
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.ADMIN_SELECT_PRESET_DOC: Choose an existing preset to edit
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.ADMIN_LOAD_DOC: Load selected preset into form fields for editing
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.ADMIN_IMPORT_FILE_DOC: Path to JSON file on the system (e.g., /data/INTERNAL/display_presets.json)
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.ADMIN_EXPORT_DOC: Export draft as display_presets.json for GitHub PR
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.ADMIN_ERROR_INVALID_TYPE: Invalid type. Must be: hdmi, dsi, dpi, or composite
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.ADMIN_ERROR_NO_CONFIG: Preset must have a config object
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.PM_SUBTITLE: Pi Screen Setup - Display Presets Database
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.PM_HELP_HDMI_GROUP: CEA for TVs, DMT for computer monitors
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.PM_HELP_HDMI_MODE: Mode 87 = custom timing. See RPi docs for standard modes.
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.PM_HELP_HDMI_TIMINGS: Format: h_active h_fp h_sync h_bp v_active v_fp v_sync v_bp v_sync_pol h_sync_pol interlace pixel_rep framerate aspect pixel_freq clock_mode flags
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.PM_HELP_HDMI_CVT: Format: width height framerate [aspect margins interlace rb]
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.PM_HELP_MAX_FB_HEIGHT: For portrait displays taller than wide
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.PM_HELP_PIXEL_FREQ: Override pixel clock limit in Hz
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.PM_HELP_HDMI_BOOST: Signal strength boost (0-11). Try 4-7 for long cables.
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.PM_HELP_DSI_OVERLAY: Main DSI overlay. Can include parameters after comma.
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.PM_HELP_DSI_OVERLAY2: Optional secondary overlay for touch or special features
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.PM_HELP_DPI_OVERLAY2: Overlay for Pi 2 and Pi 3 boards
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.PM_HELP_DPI_OVERLAY4: Overlay for Pi 4 and Pi 5 boards
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.PM_HELP_SDTV_MODE: Select video standard for your region
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.PM_HELP_EXTRA_CONFIG: For advanced or unusual config keys not covered above. Must be valid JSON object.
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.PM_WARNING_DELETE: This action cannot be undone. Please verify this is the correct preset.
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.PM_TOAST_ID_EXISTS: A preset with this ID already exists
PI_SCREEN_SETUP.PM_TOAST_JSON_OBJECT_REQUIRED: Additional parameters must be a JSON object
